newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Burns Philp shares drop on spice exit.
newsitem.headline: Burns Philp shares drop on spice exit.

text.p: Shares in troubled food group fell over eight percent in early trade on Tuesday after Monday's announcement that it could make further writedowns in the value of the spice and herb businesses it plans to sell.
At 10.25 a.m. (0025 GMT), Burns Philp shares were 16 cents or 8.16 percent weaker at A$1.80, with over 500,000 shares traded, but off their morning low of A$1.78.
In a surprise announcement on Monday, Burns Philp said it would sell all its interests in the spice and herb trade and focus on its yeast operations.

The group also announced a third quarter loss of A$23.4 million for the three months ended March 31, 1997 compared with a profit of A$7.1 million a year earlier and that managing director Ian Clack, who was promoted three years ago to oversee the company's expansion into more exotic condiments, would retire.
